fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33779].
  {panel}

Hi,

could you please add *visible* comment IDs?
That would be really helpful when you're referring to a specific comment.
"See comment #12 ..." and so on. Right now it is *not* clear at all without counting the comments yourself or adding those weird links to a comment.

You could take a look at Bugzilla for example. It has comments IDs and those are easily accessible through links like: http://somehost.org/<bugid>#c<commentid> so http://somehost.org/1337#c1
fields.summary: Add visible comment IDs

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33775].
  {panel}

Within the last OnDemand upgrades, the "View Workflow" option inside the issues has changed. Prior to the upgrade, this option showed the workflow as if you were viewing it in the *Diagram* mode. It seems that now the workflow appears using the LABS mode (which was recently introduced in OD) and there is no way to turn this option off or to change the view mode back to Diagram.

*LABS option inside the Workflow editor*

!labs_mode.png!

*"View Workflow" option inside an issue*

!view_workflow.png!
fields.summary: View Workflow option has changed
Inline Thumbnail images should open to overlay, same as in the attachments area

fields.description: We have a group of issues over 2 projects, for which we are unable to move to 'In Progress'.  I have validated permissions and workflows.  The workflow in use is shared by 13 projects, we are only seeing this issue with 2 projects.  The symptom that is consistent, for the stories that we are unable to move, they all are showing a Resolved date and time which is the same as the created date and time, however the issue is NOT resolved.  It is an Open, unresolved status and there is no history to indicate that anyone had resolved and reopened these issues.
fields.summary: Unable to move stories to 'In Progress'

        <!--<resource type="download" name="jquery.uix.multiselect_de.js" location="/js/jquery.uix.multiselect_de.js"/>

        <resource type="download" name="jquery.uix.multiselect_ru.js" location="/js/jquery.uix.multiselect_ru.js"/>

My gadget makes two AJAX REST calls: One that requests html template for the view, and one that requests data to display in a table.
In my local running jira, my gadget is running fine, but when I deploy it to our production jira, after the second ajax call, the one who requests data for a table, I get the following javascript error messages:

In Chrome: "Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined" in file "com.atlassian.auiplugin:jquery-lib.js:2"

In Firefox: "TypeError: a is undefined
..."resolve"],fail:[b,"reject"],progress:[c,"notify"]},function(a,b){var c=b[0],e=b..." also in file "com.atlassian.auiplugin:jquery-lib.js:2"

I used a File diff tool and found only one big difference: In the production gadget.xml, my js-resources were packed into one file, called "[...]/download/batch/mygadget:resources/mygadget:resources.js"
But in my local jira the resources were loaded separately.

Can this be the reason for the exception?
Thanks in advance
fields.summary: Gadget throws javascript exception when deploying on production JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33767].
  {panel}

JIRA uses propertySet to limit the characters in some of the fields in JIRA, and in this case it limits the character limit to only 255. According to [AbstractPropertySet|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/javadoc/opensymphony-propertyset/1.5/reference/com/opensymphony/module/propertyset/AbstractPropertySet.html], JIRA will throws {{IllegalPropertyException}} if value length greater than 255. The following is the error thrown
{noformat}2013-07-03 02:43:08,819 ajp-8009-3 ERROR HUFibinZ 163x5046x2 441cch 10.95.34.16,130.164.54.165 /secure/admin/NIEditHandlerDetails.jspa [plugins.mail.webwork.AbstractEditHandlerDetailsWebAction] Unable to add service: PO_FAX_SERVER
com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.IllegalPropertyException: String exceeds 255 characters.
        at com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.AbstractPropertySet.setString(AbstractPropertySet.java:297)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.OfBizServiceConfigStore.createPropertySet(OfBizServiceConfigStore.java:283)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.OfBizServiceConfigStore.editServiceConfig(OfBizServiceConfigStore.java:89)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.DefaultServiceManager.editService(DefaultServiceManager.java:235)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.webwork.AbstractEditHandlerDetailsWebAction.doExecute(AbstractEditHandlerDetailsWebAction.java:169)
        at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165){noformat}

The expectation is to have JIRA handles it better to avoid exception from happening. JIRA has {{entitymodel}} to create the field length in the database, perhaps this could be the configuration it refers to instead. With that, the {{setText}} method can be used instead of {{setString}} method for the {{AbstractPropertySet}} class.
fields.summary: Avoid exception thrown by PropertySet class

fields.description:
When JIRA's default language is set to *Deutsch (Deutschland)*, the date examples in the Look and Feel page do not escape the *& nbsp;* entity correctly. (which is supposed to represent a non-breaking space.)
As an example: [^DateAndTime.jpg]

Steps to reproduce:
# Install JIRA 6.0.3
# Go to General Configuration and change JIRA's default language to *Deutsch (Deutschland)*

Notes:
The Z. B. is an abbreviation for "zum Beispiel", or "For example".
fields.summary: Date examples in Look and Feel do not escape the   entity correctly when language is set to Deutsch
Upgrade to latest JSU in OD - 1.4.7

fields.description: Currently the mail fetcher actually fetches deleted emails for processing, not only is this wasteful but it also results in giving mail handlers unexpected input. Mail Handlers should not have to deal with deleted emails, if an email is deleted we know that it was not meant for processing.
fields.summary: The Mail Fetcher should not fetch deleted emails for processing.

Steps to reproduce:

* Create a screen with two tabs: "Field Tab" and "Tab 2"
* On the "Field Tab", leave all the default JIRA fields and add one custom field
* On "Tab 2", add another custom field

If you fill the custom fields on both tabs, both tabs will be displayed on the "View Issue Screen", however, if you leave the custom fields empty on one of the tabs, no tabs are displayed, and the custom field will be placed on the Details section of the View Issue Screen.

fields.description:
I'm using some date time custom fields in some projects. I have noticed that the custom fields do not follow the same rendering as the date time system fields.

For example, one of my custom fields captures the date and time of a workflow transition. The value of custom field is the same as {{Updated}} date time system field. Although values are the same the two date time fields have different rendering in view issue screen. More details in {{datetime_1.png}}.

The second inconsistency appears in issue navigator. In issue navigator the date time system field has only the date value but the date time custom field has both date time values. More details in {{datetime_2.png}}.
fields.summary: Datetime custom fields do not render the same way as system datetime fields

fields.description:
The InvalidInputException is thrown by many plugins that provide
additional validators, like for example to make a field mandatory
during a transition or to force the user to modify a fields content.

When the screen of such a transition has also a user picker field,
that might be the assignee field itself, or any additional custom field
of this type, whatever the user enters will be lost, once the plugin
throws the exception during validation.

For example force the user to change the Fix Version/s field.
Assuming he only modified the Assignee, but forgot the
version. See attached before and after screenshots.

In that case JIRA, will interrupt the workflow transition, and the user
picker field it's content will become invalid. Sure the user will see
the red message below the Fix Version/s field, and corrects the
input. But he won't see that the Assignee field contents changed
too, into a simple text input, non validated by JIRA, and thus when
tying again to complete the transition, the assignee input will get
lost.

 !after_transition.png|thumbnail! 
 !before_transition.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: InvalidInputException during workflow invalidates input of user picker
Keystore Password setting in JIRA Configuration tool should be masked

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33739].
  {panel}

As an administrator, I would like to be able to select the level of stemming that is applied when JIRA indexes documents in the English language to be able to improve the relevance of query results according to the nature of the content stored in the index.

The set of options would be:

* English - Aggresive Stemming. (Current Strategy)
* English - Moderate Stemming.
* English - Minimal Stemming.
fields.summary: Stemming options for indexing in the english language

Each message represents 986 bytes of error logs and this means that we are creating about 1Kb every single time we get this exception and we create thousands of them. So this is about a 1Mb log penalty every single time that this happens: although it is only in he mail handler logs I think it should still be fixed.

My suggested fix is that, if you notice this exception, stop processing email. The folder is closed, you are not going to be able to read any more emails from this folder.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create Version 1.0 in a project
# Create Version Picker (Single) named "New Version"
# Create an Issue and assign Version 1.0 to Fix Version and New Version 
# Try deleting "Version 1.0" from Project Administrator

*System field behavior:*

If you use versions in a Fix Version in an issue, and then attempt to delete the version in project admin, we will throw a dialog warning you that the issue is being used in a version field.

!Screen Shot 2013-07-03 at 10.04.24 AM.png!

*Custom field behavior:*

If you create a custom field, of type Single Version Picker, then create an issue and pick a version to fill this field, and then try and delete this version from the project admin screen, we will say it is not being used anywhere.

!Screen Shot 2013-07-03 at 10.19.59 AM.png!

h3. Expected Version Picker custom field behavior:
You get the same kind of warning as when you use a system field to hold your versions. Same behaviour as system field.

h3. Additional Affect
Database inconsistency. The value of the New Version field still exist in {{customfieldvalue}} table but it could not find any related version in {{projectversion}} table. 
{code:sql}select * from customfieldvalue where issue=<issueid> and customfield <cfid>;{code}

fields.description:
For [whatever reason|https://jamieechlin.atlassian.net/browse/GRV-282], it's possible that the *sequence* value for an Option object can be null (the API should not have allowed it if was a problem).

In jira 5.x this didn't seem to cause any problem, but in jira 6.x this causes an indexing failure:

{code}
MultiSelectCFType.compare failed for option1: FIRST option2: SECOND
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.MultiSelectCFType$1.compare(MultiSelectCFType.java:100)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.MultiSelectCFType$1.compare(MultiSelectCFType.java:94)
        at java.util.Arrays.mergeSort(Arrays.java:1270)
        ....
        millions more
{code}

This is a serious issue because just one issue with this problem will break a full reindex, leaving the index half complete.

[GRV-282|https://jamieechlin.atlassian.net/browse/GRV-282] has a workaround.

h3. To reproduce

* Create a multiselect custom field with a few options. 
* Create an issue and set 2 options for this custom field.
* Set the sequence to null using the database.
* Restart jira or clear internal caches.
* Reindex all.

*As a possible workaround solution:*
Open the customfield configuration, edit the options, just change one option's order to higher or lower then change back. Then click on the button "Done" to save the change. The sequence will be added.
fields.summary: Indexing failure for issues that multiple options specified in a multiselect list, if the sequence value is null for any option

fields.description:
When using the Date Time custom field type, the property to disable relative dates and times is not respected. Screenshot of repro, and correctly picked up property from the System Info page to confirm.

Steps to repro:

I just took a clean instance, added a single custom field with a date time type. This field applied to every single project and screen. The instance had the property set in the jira-config.properties file, and was confirmed to be set during runtime in the System Information page. Then I created multiple issues. These issues all had the test custom field set on them. The values set were between 48 hours old, and 48 hours in the future. Some values were within hours of now, others within minutes. Everything within a short period of time showed up with relative time instead of absolute.
fields.summary: custom fields do not respect jira.lf.date.relativize = false

fields.description:
h3. Steps to replicate:
# Create a new Workflow - *Matheus's Test Workflow*
# Create a new Workflow Scheme - *Matheus's Test Workflow Scheme*
# Associate *Matheus's Test Workflow* with 'All Unassigned Issue Types'
# On the *Workflow Schemes* page, click on *Matheus's Test Workflow*:
|!workflow.png!|

h3. Expected Behavior:
The workflow would be displayed.

h3. Actual Behavior:
An error message is shown:
|!error.png!|

h3. Workaround:
* If the workflow is *inactive*, simply edit the workflow and rename it, removing the apostrophe character.
* If the workflow is *active*, create a copy of it changing its name in the process, and associate the workflow scheme to this new workflow. If using JIRA 5.x, create a copy of the workflow scheme as well as it's not possible to edit active workflow schemes.
fields.summary: Not Found Error when viewing Workflow containing name with Apostrophe

  {panel}

A customer has made the following request:

JIRA shouldn't allow you to attach files with the same name, at the same time without giving a warning or message at least. 

One justification is that the user is able to attach multiple copies of the very same file with a single action, and this is hardly necessary or useful.

Another related issue with this is that, in the case where this file has been modified outside JIRA, it may not be possible to tell the different files apart within JIRA because they can be attached with the same file name, as JIRA doesn't enforce a rename in this case.

*how to reproduce current behavior:*
Try to attach files to an issue in JIRA, you would find that you are able to select the very same file again and again and succesfully add it to the issue with the same file name, within the same dialog.
fields.summary: JIRA shouldn't allow file attachment with the same name at the same time

Basically, customer mention that when they have their JIRA setup with Apache proxy and SSL the what's new content (some may call it the JIRA welcome page) in JIRA 6.0.1 will not be shown.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Setup JIRA with Apache proxy and SSL
# Access JIRA with one new user which has never login before (via IE10 or Google Chrome internet browser)

!1.jpg!

h3. According to customer analysing:
This seems to be an issue with the linked iframe content that is redirected to content that is http. Since it redirects from https to http back to https, the internet browser wont show it as http is considered unsecure Iframe content.
Please refer to the following screenshots: [^screenshot-1.jpg] and [^screenshot-2.jpg]

{panel:title=Welcome!|borderColor=#333| titleBGColor=#efefef|bgColor=#fff}
Hi,

Welcome to the *testing program* for the new workflow functionality that we are currently building.

h3. What's going to happen

I'm going to update this JIRA issue every time we add new functionality or incorporate any feedback you have provided. There are no obligations to participate in this program - simply play with the feature and provide feedback whenever you like.

h3. What we are after

The team really loves it when we get feedback on what we're building. Whether it be good or bad, it allows us to improve the feature much more rapidly than we could without feedback.

There is a 'Got Feedback?' button in the top right hand corner of the page you are going to be using. If you could click that and send all feedback/bugs/problems etc through, it will be raised in one of our JIRA instances and we can manage it there. If that doesn't work for any reason, please email me. :)

h3. What you need to do

This is an interesting experiment on my part because we are using one OnDemand instance, which you all have admin access to. Please be nice to one another and only play with workflows/projects/objects that you create.

Steps:
1. You will have been sent an email with credentials to an JIRA test instance - https://admin-feedback.jira-dev.com/ (your passwords are your usernames. Feel free to change them if you wish)
2. Create a workflow
3. Play around with the new designer functionality
4. Give us feedback!

Thanks in advance for any feedback or thoughts you have! 

Best Regards,
Josh
{panel}
\\{panel:title=Things that were in the old designer, but won't be implemented in the new designer|borderColor=#333| titleBGColor=#faacad|bgColor=#fff}
* Clone transition
* Annotations
{panel}
\\
{panel:title=Bugs that have been picked up by this program|borderColor=#333| titleBGColor=#009ACD|bgColor=#fff}
* Creating a status with a long name fails without a proper specification of why. I tried to give it a name of about 65k letters. Perhaps add a maxlength to the textbox?
* Sometimes when going into full screen mode, the tooltip is moved to the top leftmost part of the screen (see attached screenshot).
* FIXED -When I drag a status off the drawing area, the status stops at the edge of the drawing area. If I release the mouse button and move the mouse back onto the drawing area, the status follows me around.-
* If I can't add a new transition to a draft workflow, then the designer should know that and not let me do it graphically, then ask for name+description, before giving an error message.
* FIXED -it is possible to move the transition label "Create issue".-
* FIXED -When scrolling down the page, the workflow designer zooms (fix is in progress for this)-
* FIXED -You can add a status, but it is hard to find where it appeared unless you zoom way out-
* FIXED -When moving statuses, the cursor doesn't change to a "cross with arrows"-
* FIXED -"Create issue" transition can be moved-
* FIXED -Blue snap to object lines try to snap to everything (a fix is in progress for this :))-
{panel}

        {}com.atlassian.jira.rpc.exception.RemoteException:null
        {http://xml.apache.org/axis/}hostname:afaisal-PC

com.atlassian.jira.rpc.exception.RemoteValidationException: Fields not valid for issue:
Errors: {}
Error Messages: [You do not have permission to edit issues in this project.]
        at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
[......]
{noformat}

The error message "You do not have permission to edit issues in this project" is correct, but the {{RemoteValidationException: Fields not valid for issue}} can be misleading. 

It will be great if we can update the error message so stating that the error occur because the issue is non-editable in Closed status.
fields.summary: Misleading error message appears if we try to update a closed issue using SOAP API (updateIssue)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33686].
  {panel}

If using _Spanish - Latin America (es-419)_ as preferred language in Google Chrome browser, some functionalities in JIRA can cause a _500 Internal Server Error_, as the following:

{noformat}
2013-06-12 09:33:46,648 http-bio-9060-exec-11 ERROR admin 573x398x1 15465ge 127.0.0.1 /rest/project-templates/1.0/templates [jersey.spi.container.ContainerResponse] Mapped exception to response: 500 (Internal Server Error)
javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException: java.text.ParseException: String, es-419, is not a valid language tag
    at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.model.HttpHelper.clientError(HttpHelper.java:265)
    at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.model.HttpHelper.getAcceptLanguage(HttpHelper.java:222)
    at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.VariantSelector.selectVariant(VariantSelector.java:290)
    at com.sun.jersey.spi.container.ContainerRequest.selectVariant(ContainerRequest.java:679)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)  <+2> (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)  <+1> (WebApplicationImpl.java:287)
    at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy1948.selectVariant(Unknown Source)  <+3> (Status.java:347) (SecurityExceptionMapper.java:23) (SecurityExceptionMapper.java:15)
    at com.sun.jersey.spi.container.ContainerResponse.mapException(ContainerResponse.java:452)  <+5> (WebApplicationImpl.java:1406) (WebApplicationImpl.java:1349) (WebApplicationImpl.java:1339) (WebComponent.java:416) (ServletContainer.java:537)
 
...
Caused by: java.text.ParseException: String, es-419, is not a valid language tag
    at com.sun.jersey.core.header.LanguageTag.parse(LanguageTag.java:122)
    at com.sun.jersey.core.header.AcceptableLanguageTag.<init>(AcceptableLanguageTag.java:69)
    at com.sun.jersey.core.header.reader.HttpHeaderReader$8.create(HttpHeaderReader.java:418)
    at com.sun.jersey.core.header.reader.HttpHeaderReader$8.create(HttpHeaderReader.java:416)
    at com.sun.jersey.core.header.reader.HttpHeaderReader.readList(HttpHeaderReader.java:465)
    at com.sun.jersey.core.header.reader.HttpHeaderReader.readAcceptableList(HttpHeaderReader.java:436)
    at com.sun.jersey.core.header.reader.HttpHeaderReader.readAcceptLanguage(HttpHeaderReader.java:423)  <+1> (HttpHelper.java:220)
{noformat}

We have a KB suggesting a workaround for this:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/500-internal-server-error-due-to-parseexception-es-419-is-not-a-valid-language-tag-369295958.html
fields.summary: Incompatibility with Spanish Latin America language in Chrome

fields.description:
Copy Issue button ( using JIRA to JIRA Copy plugin 3.2 ) not functioning when you try to do a Remote Issue Copy you will get the below exception if one of the comments is owned by an invalid user (removed).

{noformat}
2013-07-01 21:33:53,490 http-bio-8081-exec-25 ERROR admin 1293x1524x1 f1po3e 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/CopyIssueToInstanceAction.jspa [atlassian.cpji.action.CopyIssueToInstanceAction] NegativeResponseStatus(ERROR_OCCURRED, errors: Errors: {reporter=The reporter specified is not a user.}
Error Messages: [])
{noformat}

The problem is reproducible when the following criteria's are met:
* JIRA is integrated with Crowd.
* The issue has existing comments and one of the comments is owned by an invalid user (removed). 
* The valid user perform the action (COPY) locally from Project A to project B.

*Steps to reproduce the problem:*
# Setup a new JIRA 5.2.11 and integrate it with Crowd.
# Install JIRA to JIRA copy plugin 3.2
# Create 2 projects - Project A and Project B.
# Create one issue in project A.
# User A comment on it and configure the user A become inactive in Crowd directory. After that, sync the user directories in JIRA.
# Logged in as admin user to copy the issue by click on Remote Copy _more action -> remote copy_
# After click next button to _select project -> update details -> confirmation operation_ page.
# Try select internal or valid user for *Assignee* and click *Copy Issue* button but JIRA do not redirect the page or shown any success message.
# The following error shown in JIRA log:
{noformat}
2013-07-01 21:33:53,490 http-bio-8081-exec-25 ERROR admin 1293x1524x1 f1po3e 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/CopyIssueToInstanceAction.jspa [atlassian.cpji.action.CopyIssueToInstanceAction] NegativeResponseStatus(ERROR_OCCURRED, errors: Errors: {reporter=The reporter specified is not a user.}
Error Messages: [])
{noformat}
fields.summary: Copy Issue button not functioning when JIRA integrated with Crowd
Workflow Diagram in Edit mode

fields.description:
In a new filter I have added a number of search/selection fields (some default and some customer) and modified the column view to e.g. present the data of some of the added fields.
The filter is saved and everything works fine. 
I check the print view and it looks exactly like the screen view.
Now I change the content of some of the search/selection fields and verifies that the screen view are as expected, which it is. But when I look at the print view it is 'reset' to default view without the added column.
fields.summary: Mismatch between screen view and print view (Export->Printable)

fields.description:
I want to create filters that contains one or more search/selection fields which are associated with the project e.g. the standard Resolution field or a custom field. 

When I save the filter with e.g. the Resolution field as 'Resolution: All' the filter will be removed from the saved filter next time the filter is selected. If I save the filter as ''Resolution: Fixed' is will be stored correctly and the field will remain visible.

In my opinion this hidden 'intelligence' that removes search/selection fields are very inappropriate and are almost to be categorized as a major bug.
fields.summary: Search/selection field in filter disappear when saved

fields.description: When you upgrade JIRA and you import data during the setup phase, JIRA johnsons if the license is invalid.  No JIRA upgrade tasks are run, however any plugin upgrade tasks still run.  The plugin upgrade tasks should not run unless JIRA upgrade tasks have run.
fields.summary: Plugin upgrades run even when JIRA upgrades don't

*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33672].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 20 September 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}

Hi everyone,

Thanks for your interest in this issue. This suggestion is considered a potential addition to our longer-term roadmap. We'll typically review this request in about 12 months time, at which point we’ll consider whether we need to alter its status.

For the nearest future we've decided to prioritize other areas of the Jira Server roadmap, including the top-voted suggestions:
* Further performance and stability improvements
* Email notifications template editor available from the UI JRASERVER-7266
* Jira email notifications batching JRASERVER-1369
* Mobile app for Jira Server JRASERVER-46149
* Improved filter and dashboard management by Jira administrators JRASERVER-15900 and JRASERVER-41269 
* Adding the "updated-by" JQL search query JRASERVER-1973
* Support for 4 byte characters in MySQL connection JRASERVER-36135

In the recent Jira Server releases we have also shipped some highly-voted features and improvements, including:
* Filters and dashboards collaborative editing
* Selectable delimiters in CSV export 
* Microsoft SQL Server 2016 support 
* iPv6 support
* Faster Kanban boards
* Refreshed projects and custom fields management pages in the admin's section 

We hope that you appreciate our candid and transparent communication. You can learn more about our approach to highly voted server suggestions here.

To learn more on how you suggestions are reviewed, see our updated workflow for server feature suggestions.

Kind regards,
Jira Server Product Management
{panel}

To delete a label to be completely removed from a project in JIRA, the label must be removed from all the issues in that project. Once it is removed from all issues, it will no longer be suggested in autocomplete or when browsing a project's labels.

This functionality could be improved by having a way to simply delete the label when accessing a project, instead of going to each issue (or performing bulk operations).
fields.summary: Improve the way Labels can be deleted in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33667].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:
1. Create SMTP mail Server
2. Setup POP/IMAP mail server and a *create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue* mail handler and check the *CC Watchers* field
3. Send an email with the cc field to some other email address(which the user is register in JIRA) to the mail server and JIRA expectedly create a issue from it and added cc field email address into watchers of that issue.
4. After that, if continue to reply that email it will actually comment on that issue however if the cc field of the mail address is added some other email address, it won't add those email address as watchers.

h3. Customer expectation
The *CC Watchers* function should work even when user commenting on the exisiting issues that is created by the mail handler.
fields.summary: Creating Issues and Comments mail handler doesn't add CC fields to watcher on issue that is already created
Project importer should be able to handle the empty string for the assignee/project lead

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33665].
  {panel}

There is this user who is having the following scenario in his JIRA instance, and wants a feature in JIRA that will enable the automation of such transition:
* The project manager will have a parent task including a lot of sub-tasks.
* Those sub-tasks will be assigned to different user groups, and will get notified once those sub-tasks are created.
* Those user groups will put all their comments on the sub-tasks assigned to them
* When the due-date comes, the project manager wants to gather all those comments by all user groups and output it into a seperated file.
fields.summary: Gather feedback and save it in a separated file
JQL to retrieve issues last modified by either a specific user or a or a user belonging to a group / role.
